alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 1:25AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe, north central Baldwin, central Washington, Clarke and Wilcox Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 125 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Miller to 7 miles west of Fulton to 5 miles southeast of Millry to 4 miles north of Buckatunna. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Jackson, Thomasville, Camden, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Chatom, Peterman, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Uriah, Whatley, Tibbie, Pine Hill, Millry, Excel, Beatrice, Coffeeville and Vredenburgh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox
